sentences: James John Turner Phillips (born 7 July 1932) is an English lyricist who used the pen name John Turner.

== Biography ==

sentences: He ran the Peter Maurice Music Company, whose most important lyricist was Geoffrey Parsons.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: The company specialized in adapting songs originally in foreign languages into the English language.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: He would usually assign a song to Parsons and when the latter was finished, suggest some changes.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: The credits for the English lyrics would then be given as "John Turner and Geoffrey Parsons".
section: == Biography ==

sentences: The words of "Smile" to the music of Charlie Chaplin, was written  at the Peter Maurice Music Company office on Denmark Street, London in 1954.
